cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then expected to stall inland over south-central Texas through early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi/Port O’Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: All watches confined to the south Texas coast (Port Mansfield southward). None issued east of the Mouth of the Rio Grande.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Port Mansfield-High Island TX; Hurricane warning Port Mansfield-Sargent TX; Tropical-storm warning Sargent-High Island TX. No warnings for Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impact expected along the Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana; only outer rainbands expected farther east along the Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at the port (≤4 % probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the MS coast; heights above 3 ft are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–4 in of rain with isolated higher totals if bands linger.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches; brief coastal squalls in feeder bands.
